title: Trigonal trapezohedron
summary: In geometry, a trigonal trapezohedron is a rhombohedron (a polyhedron with six rhombus-shaped faces) in which, additionally, all six faces are congruent. Alternative names for the same shape are the trigonal deltohedron[1] or isohedral rhombohedron.[2] Some sources just call them rhombohedra.[3]
